senses.de: The ability or chance to use or see something
senses.ex: You will need to get special permission for access to the building.

Tips.title: Requesting Permission
Tips.description: Sometimes, 'access' is about permission, especially for restricted areas or information.
Tips.example: Students must request access to the restricted section of the library.

Tips.title: Physical and Digital
Tips.description: 'Access' applies to both physical spaces and digital assets, like websites or databases.
Tips.example: Our premium subscription gives you access to all articles.

Tips.title: Accessibility
Tips.description: Access can reflect inclusivity, e.g. providing ramps for wheelchair users.
Tips.example: The new office design improves access for people with disabilities.

senses.de: The act of reaching, achieving, or getting something
senses.ex: Internet access is available in all the rooms.

Tips.title: Network Availability
Tips.description: In computing, 'access' often refers to the availability and permission to use network resources.
Tips.example: Our hotel guarantees guests 24/7 internet access.

Tips.title: Security Importance
Tips.description: 'Access' involves security; unauthorized access can lead to data breaches.
Tips.example: The system's security update will prevent unauthorized access.

senses.de: To get to, or get inside something
senses.ex: You need a password to access your account.

Tips.title: Tech Proficiency
Tips.description: Using 'access' as a verb usually implies a user's ability to use tech tools or resources effectively.
Tips.example: You can access our online resources using the library computers.

Tips.title: Online Interaction
Tips.description: Verb 'access' shows action in online environments, like opening a website or a document.
Tips.example: Sam accessed the document through the cloud service.

senses.ex: He was taken to the hospital after an access of coughing and fever.

Tips.title: Emotional Surge
Tips.description: Archaically, 'access' referred to sudden emotional or physical outbursts, not commonly used today.
Tips.example: The novel describes an access of passion in its hero.

Tips.title: Historical Context
Tips.description: Recognize 'access' in historical or literary texts to understand older meanings about sudden attacks.
Tips.example: In classic literature, characters often suffer an access of despair.

Admission.wordDefinition:
Access refers to the ability or permission to enter or use something, while admission refers to the act of being allowed to enter a place or event.

For example, you may have access to a library if you have a library card, but you need admission to watch a movie at a theater by purchasing a ticket.

Access refers to being able to use something, while admission refers to being allowed to enter a place or event.

Approach.wordDefinition:
Approach refers to the act of getting closer to something or someone, usually with the intention of reaching a goal or destination.

For example, a hiker might approach a mountain summit or a student might approach their teacher for extra help.

Access means getting in, while approach means getting closer. Access is applicable when referring to gaining entry or permission to use something, while approach is applicable in situations where getting closer to something or someone is necessary to achieve a goal.

Connection.wordDefinition:
Connection refers to the link or relationship between two or more things or people.

It can refer to physical connections, such as wires or cables, or virtual connections, such as Wi-Fi or Bluetooth.

In practical terms, access is applicable when you want to get into or use something, while connection is applicable when you want to link up with or communicate with something or someone.

For example, you need access to your school's library to borrow books, but you need a connection to the internet to check your email.

Entrance.wordDefinition:
Access and entrance are two different words that relate to gaining entry to a specific place or space. Access usually refers to a means of entering something like a building, room, or computer program.

It is the way that an individual can use to reach a particular area or information. Entrance refers to the process of entering a specific area or space, like an event or room.

In simpler terms, access is the way in which a person can enter an area or space, whereas an entrance is the actual place through which they enter.

For instance, a smart card is a means of access to the restricted areas of an office building, while the entrance to the building is through the front door.

Entry.wordDefinition:
Access and entry both refer to ways of getting into a place or using something, but there are some differences in their meanings.

Entry means the physical act of going into a place or space, such as a room or a building. It refers to the point of passage, the act of entering or gaining access to a place.

Access refers to the ability to use or reach something, while entry refers to the act of physically entering a space. So, I can access a website online, but I need to have the right entry code to get into a building.

Gateway.wordDefinition:
Gateway refers to a point of entry or exit that connects two different systems or spaces. For example, a gateway can connect two computer networks or two parts of a city.

A gateway can also refer to a specific website or online platform that serves as a starting point for accessing other information or resources.

Access is about being able to enter or use something, while a gateway is a point of entry or exit that connects two different systems or spaces.

Access is applicable to many different situations where permission or ability to use something is needed, while gateway is typically used in a technological context to describe a connection between different systems or platforms.

Passage.wordDefinition:
Passage means a way through or a path from one place to another. It is applicable when someone needs to move from one location to another.

For instance, a person can use a passage to access a building and then use their access to enter a specific room or space within the building.

Route.wordDefinition:
Access and route are two different words with distinct meanings. Access refers to the ability or right to use or enter something.

A route refers to a path or way that leads from one place to another. It's about the journey itself, rather than the ability to enter or use something.

A route can be a road, a trail, or even a series of instructions that someone follows to get from one place to another.

Access is about getting into or using something, while a route is about the path or way to get from one place to another.

quotes.Text: I like collecting comics, I like buying comics, I like looking at comics, but I also read comics on digital readers, so any way people read comics is fine with me. Digital is just helping people who might not necessarily have access to comics help them; that's great.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Geoff Johns

quotes.Text: The world has not yet reached the point which, in my view, is an essential condition for the survival of our human species: access by all the peoples to the material resources of this planet.
quotes.Title: Statesman
quotes.Name: Fidel Castro

quotes.Text: I think our democracy has it exactly right: two terms, eight years. It's enough. Because it's important to have one foot in reality when you have access to this kind of power.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Michelle Obama

quotes.Text: It's not enough to train today's workforce. We also have to prepare tomorrow's workforce by guaranteeing every child access to a world-class education.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: Life is a perspective and for me, if a human being has access to school, clean water, food, proper health care, that is the basis of human rights.
quotes.Title: Ethiopian Model
quotes.Name: Gelila Bekele

quotes.Text: What's really great about social media is we have tremendous access, and there's a wealth of information about the people that we admire online.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Franchesca Ramsey

quotes.Text: I've known and continue to know every one of these major world leaders by their first names, and I have access to them.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Joe Biden

quotes.Text: People just want to have access to all of the world's music.
quotes.Title: Swedish Businessman
quotes.Name: Daniel Ek

quotes.Text: My sons have such a deep access to my heart.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Austin Peck

quotes.Text: Celebrity gets you access to world leaders.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Michael Douglas
